resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
HashidaTKS commented on pull request #6102: ARROW-7290 [C#] Implement ListArray Builder
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6102
 
 
   * Add ListArray.Builder
   * Add ArrowArrayBuilderFactory
   * Change IArrowArrayBuilder
   Some builders like ListArray.Builder don't need specify a value on Append. To support such builders, I added IArrowArrayBuilder<TArray, TBuilder>> and changed IArrowArrayBuilder<T, TArray, TBuilder>> to inherit it.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

HashidaTKS commented on issue #6102: ARROW-7290: [C#] Implement ListArray Builder
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6102#issuecomment-572432251
 
 
   * Change to use `ListArray.Builder` in `Visit(ListType type)` of TestData.cs.
   * Fix minor details
   * Add `ListArray.GetSlicedValues(int index)`
     * This corresponds to [`value_slice()` in C++](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/array.h#L572).
     * I added this to improve usability and simplify test implementation.

eerhardt commented on pull request #6102: ARROW-7290: [C#] Implement ListArray Builder
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6102#discussion_r364988718
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/test/Apache.Arrow.Tests/ArrayBuilderTests.cs
 ##########
 @@ -38,6 +39,101 @@ public void PrimitiveArrayBuildersProduceExpectedArray()
             TestArrayBuilder<DoubleArray, DoubleArray.Builder>(x => x.Append(10).Append(20).Append(30));
         }
 
+
+        [Fact]
+        public void ListArrayBuilder()
+        {
+            var list = CreateList();
+
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "1" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(0) as StringArray));
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "22", "33" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(1) as StringArray));
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "444", "555", "666" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(2) as StringArray));
+
+            ListArray CreateList()
 
 Review comment:
   Why separate this into a nested method that is only called once? Why not just put the below code inline in the `ListArrayBuilder()` method?
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

 @@ -38,6 +39,101 @@ public void PrimitiveArrayBuildersProduceExpectedArray()
             TestArrayBuilder<DoubleArray, DoubleArray.Builder>(x => x.Append(10).Append(20).Append(30));
         }
 
+
+        [Fact]
+        public void ListArrayBuilder()
+        {
+            var list = CreateList();
+
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "1" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(0) as StringArray));
+            Assert.Equal(

 Review comment:
   I intended to improve readability by separating the process of creating test data from the process of checking.
   Of course, there is no need to separate them in term of functionality.
   If you feel this separation does not makes much sense, I'll modify it.

HashidaTKS commented on issue #6102: ARROW-7290: [C#] Implement ListArray Builder
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6102#issuecomment-572935277
 
 
   Currently, `ArrowWriterBenchmark` throws exception in case `BatchLength` is 1000000 and `ColumnSetCount` is 25.
   
   ```
   System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.IO.IOException: Stream was too long.
   ```
   
   I think one of the following will solve the problem, which is better?
   
   * remove or comment out [this line](https://github.com/HashidaTKS/arrow/blob/ARROW-7290_Implement_ListArrayBuilder/csharp/test/Apache.Arrow.Tests/TestData.cs#L56)
   * decrease `ColumnSetCount` or `BatchLength` to a appropriate number
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 ##########
 @@ -38,6 +39,101 @@ public void PrimitiveArrayBuildersProduceExpectedArray()
             TestArrayBuilder<DoubleArray, DoubleArray.Builder>(x => x.Append(10).Append(20).Append(30));
         }
 
+
+        [Fact]
+        public void ListArrayBuilder()
+        {
+            var list = CreateList();
+
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "1" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(0) as StringArray));
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "22", "33" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(1) as StringArray));
+            Assert.Equal(
+                new List<string> { "444", "555", "666" },
+                ConvertStringArrayToList(list.GetSlicedValues(2) as StringArray));
+
+            ListArray CreateList()
 
 Review comment:
   Thank you for your feedback.
   I myself had wondered whether this approach is easy to read for others.
   Hearing your opinion, I decided to avoid using this inner method.
